channel.title: Google Ranking
channel.description:
Im currently starting to upgrade some of my web packages that I offer to customers. I want to be able to add Google Ranking to get their site onto page 1 for certain search terms. for example, http://www.tpsl.co.uk I want these terms:
Harrogate Computer Repairs
Harrogate Computer Support
To show on the first page, however I have submitted it to google, yahoo and bing, I have put a SEO title and added keywords to the page content along with a h1 with the search term i want most. I have been adding reviews to websites such as yell.com and yelp in the hope that more content generated about the website will increase traffic thus increase its rankings. What im asking you is have you had experience in generating rankings, or have you got any documents which you can forward me that I can read to aid me. Thanks

item.title: Google Ranking
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“RLN, post:22, topic:407901”][quote author=mutex_ link=topic=509187.msg3709113#msg3709113 date=1313234858]

[quote author=cruel link=topic=509187.msg3705820#msg3705820 date=1313025225]

  1. even if you don’t have content, make it look like you do.
  2. link the fake content to adverts and other affiliates.
  3. ???
  4. Get removed from google


[/quote]Dear Google,

I’ve always wondered how websites (such as the one you showed in that picture) are able to generate dynamic content that ends up with high PageRanks. Wouldn’t you (Google) at least have the sense in realizing that the “fake content to adverts and other affiliates” are coming through your (Google) algorithms? Or is this intentional?

Sincerely,
Angry Torrent User who has hit so many of these websites (similar to image) thinking it was the actual torrent file
[/quote]It’s hard to weed those people out, as the ones that are done well use cloaking. For extremely specific keywords or keywords with low amount of searches, it’s often the case that through cloaking or what-have-you, the blackhat SEO’er actually appears to have better content than any of the other competitors for said keywords. It’s not really google’s fault, as it would be impractical to completely verify that a cloaked site is legit in some cases (not to mention hard as fuck, since the whole point of cloaking is to deceive google) and also go against their standards (user-agent for example). I would wager that the majority of the time when you end up at sites like that, though, you fucked up your google-fu. There are certain keywords that you should add to your searches to ensure the proper type of content is presented. For example, when you type “some amazing non-existent torrent” in google, without “download” as a keyword, google doesn’t know you want to download that torrent. If you did, then maybe it could verify that the sites it indexed had downloadable content for that keyword.[/quote]Specifically speaking about torrents: it’s best to just put effort into obtaining private tracker accounts; if you have enough, you can find pretty much anything on the Internet. Last I checked, if you can’t find something on private trackers, you can’t find it on the Internet (excluding Deep Web).

Read full topic

http://i.imgur.com/ox45T.png[/quote]Dear Google,

I’ve always wondered how websites (such as the one you showed in that picture) are able to generate dynamic content that ends up with high PageRanks. Wouldn’t you (Google) at least have the sense in realizing that the “fake content to adverts and other affiliates” are coming through your (Google) algorithms? Or is this intentional?

Sincerely,
Angry Torrent User who has hit so many of these websites (similar to image) thinking it was the actual torrent file

item.title: Google Ranking
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:14, topic:407901”]I still stand by my statement that SEO people are scammers and spammers, and generally just represent the scum of the internet.

Source:
All these assholes that register on the forum, post many large threads with great walls of text that mean nothing, then, after they spam ‘enough’ posts, they come back and put descriptive links to website X in their signature. I’m sure they get paid a hefty sum for this ‘SEO’ link-spamming, but I don’t appreciate it one bit, bastards…[/quote]There are plenty of genuine techniques you can use to improve your sites rank, and a badly designed website with good content may not be reaching its potential rank. If the owner of the website doesn’t know much about SEO, I don’t see what’s wrong with paying someone more experienced to do this for them.

I agree with you about the link spammers (they piss me off on my site too), but that doesn’t mean you don’t get genuine and honest SEO companies.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Ranking
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I would only want to implement it on the websites I build, I have been approached by 3 different people now offering me their SEO services for a monthly fee. I told them were to put it.

I have bought a book and am now looking at the links RLN kindly provided, hopefully this will give me some hints and tips of how I should be doing things better.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Ranking
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

any idea before i buy one of these if any of them are worth while?

amazon.co.uk

SEO Help: 20 Search Engine Optimization steps to get your website to Google's #1 page

Help your website be found without spending a fortune. Every webmaster and every website owner wants the same thing: to see their website on Google's first page and to keep it there. SEO Help is a pra ...

3.8 out of 5 stars, ISBN: 978-1844819966, New Line Publishing, 4 Jan 2010, £18.99

or

amazon.co.uk

Search Engine Optimization (SEO) Secrets

Danny Dover, Erik Dafforn

Tips, tricks, and little–known methods used by professional SEO consultants to rank in some of the most competitive search phrases Search engine optimization (SEO) is the process of creating, formatti ...

4.4 out of 5 stars, ISBN: 978-0470554180, John Wiley & Sons, 18 Mar 2011, £27.99

or

amazon.co.uk

The Art of SEO (Theory in Practice (O'Reilly))

Eric Enge, Stephan Spencer, Rand Fishkin

Four acknowledged experts in search engine optimization share guidelines and innovative techniques that will help you plan and execute a comprehensive SEO strategy. This second edition brings you up t ...

4.3 out of 5 stars, ISBN: 978-0596518868, O'Reilly Media, 31 Oct 2009

item.title: Google Ranking
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:9, topic:407901”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=509187.msg3694978#msg3694978 date=1312379167]

snake oil salesmen the lot of them

Agreed. Don’t you think if any site could pay to get to the top of google they probably would? And how exactly can all sites be at the top of google? SEO just means someone is trying to scam you. I wish I could think of nice explanatory words to go with SEO, what about “Scam Everyone Online”, since that is really their goal?
[/quote]So you’re saying there’s no such thing as SEO?[/quote]
Of course you can make you site go higher on the search lists, by making good content and help the engine a little bit, but you can’t magical make anything go on the top of the lists for £1000.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Ranking
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Add a good description, a lot of keywords, and get the site linked to from external sources. A domain name which contains similar text to what people would be searching for also helps. For example, I had a website where you could look up RuneScape experience values and the domain was runescapeexptable.com; I got ranked to like #4 when you searched for runescape exp table, runescape experience table, etc. The only ones that were higher ranked were Tip.it and RuneScape Wikia.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Mopman:

So basically, you want to charge people for SEO, but you don’t know anything about SEO?

I want to read and learn about how I can do it so that I can charge people for it, I wouldn’t charge someone for something that I dont understand. Im posting here asking for advice and information.

I have used google to search but there seems to be quite a few contrasting blogs and articles, im merely asking for help on finding the answer.
